While she didn’t say it explicitly, this line was a rebuke of the way women are treated under Shariah law in some Middle Eastern countries, as well as anywhere else where women are routinely abused. 
“For wherever women are diminished, the entire world is diminished with them. However, wherever women are empowered, towns and villages, schools and economies, are empowered, and together we are all made stronger with them,” she stated. 
Trump gave the sort of speech that should have made feminists happy, but of course it barely got any real coverage in the liberal media. After all, why would they want to point out that President Donald Trump’s wife said positive things about women? Advertisement - story continues below 
“We must continually (revere) our American values as we join with the international community to make our world safer through acts of collaborative and individual bravery,” Trump concluded. 
President Trump has vowed to do what he can to ensure that women in America have everything they need to succeed in the workforce and to help make this world a better place.
